content.raw: Has this issue been tested on Windows? I imagine we'll face similar problems, especially when compiling in Visual Studio (as opposed to `nmake`), because Visual Studio uses a multi-configuration generator for CMake. That means the location of the binary won't be known at configuration time, and we would need to use generator expressions to determine the value of `IGN_TEST_LIBRARY_PATH`. You can find an example [here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/src/923f816153a72e8eb28574bf5a1ce7f575c9bcef/test/util/CMakeLists.txt?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default) in `ign-common` for the dummy plugins. It's not a pretty solution, so suggestions for more elegant solutions are very welcome.

content.raw: I don't think `ign` works on Windows for now.
content.html: I don't think ign works on Windows for now.

content.raw:
That's understandable, since Windows isn't nearly as accommodating towards command line tools.

It seems that at some point we may be able to leverage CPack to generate `.msi` package installers for Windows, which should make it more feasible to fully support `ign` on Windows. But that's probably a conversation for another time and place.
